verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
I have heard <WH8085> many such things <WH7227>: miserable <WH5999> comforters are you all <WH5162>.
Shall vain <WH7307> words <WH1697> have an end <WH7093>? or what emboldens <WH4834> you that you answer <WH6030>?

I also could speak <WH1696> as you do <WH3863>: if your soul <WH5315> were <WH3426> in my soul <WH5315>'s place <WH2266>, I could heap up words <WH4405> against you <WH5128>, and shake my head <WH7218> at you <WH1119>.
But I would strengthen <WH553> you with <WH1119> my mouth <WH6310>, and the moving <WH5205> of my lips <WH8193> should assuage your grief <WH2820>.
Though I speak <WH1696>, my grief <WH3511> is not assuaged <WH2820>: and though I forbear <WH2308>, what am I eased <WH1980>?
But now he has made me weary <WH3811>: you have made desolate <WH8074> all my company <WH5712>.
And you have filled me with wrinkles <WH7059>, which is a witness <WH5707> against me <WH3585>: and my leanness rising up <WH6965> in me bears witness <WH6030> to my face <WH6440>.
He tears <WH2963> me in his wrath <WH639>, who hates <WH7852> me <WH2786>: he gnashes upon me with his teeth <WH8127>; my enemy <WH6862> sharpens <WH3913> his eyes upon me <WH5869>.

They have gaped <WH6473> upon me with their mouth <WH6310>; they have struck <WH5221> me upon the cheek <WH3895> reproachfully <WH2781>; they have gathered <WH4390> themselves together against me <WH3162>.
God <WH410> has delivered <WH5462> me to the ungodly <WH5760>, and turned me over <WH3399> into the hands <WH3027> of the wicked <WH7563>.
I was at ease <WH7961>, but he has broken me asunder <WH6565>: he has also taken <WH270> me by my neck <WH6203>, and shaken me to pieces <WH6327>, and set me up <WH6965> for his mark <WH4307>.

His archers <WH7228> compass me round about <WH5437>, he cleaves <WH6398> my reins <WH3629> asunder <WH6398>, and does not spare <WH2550>; he pours out <WH8210> my gall <WH4845> upon the ground <WH776>.
He breaks <WH6555> me with breach <WH6556> upon <WH6440> breach <WH6556>, he runs <WH7323> upon me like a giant <WH1368>.
I have sewed <WH8609> sackcloth <WH8242> upon my skin <WH1539>, and defiled <WH5953> my horn <WH7161> in the dust <WH6083>.
My face <WH6440> is foul <WH2560> with weeping <WH1065>, and on my eyelids <WH6079> is the shadow of death <WH6757>;
Not for any injustice <WH2555> in my hands <WH3709>: also my prayer <WH8605> is pure <WH2134>.
O earth <WH776>, cover <WH3680> not you my blood <WH1818>, and let my cry <WH2201> have no place <WH4725>.
Also now <WH5707>, behold, my witness is in heaven <WH8064>, and my record <WH7717> is on high <WH4791>.
My friends <WH7453> scorn <WH3887> me <WH5869>: but my eye pours out <WH1811> tears unto God <WH433>.
O that one might plead <WH3198> for a man <WH1397> with God <WH433>, as a man <WH120> pleads for his neighbor <WH1121>!
When a few <WH4557> years <WH8141> are come <WH857>, then I shall go <WH1980> the way <WH734> from where I shall not return <WH7725>.
